_comment: FY2024 Survey Answer Schema - stores only answers, questions are in template
_savings: ~67% space reduction vs full markdown files

engagement_grid._comment: G1: Who was engaged and how

disparities_assessment.other_methods: Discussed with the Regional Center the need for the community as well as our resource officers in the police department.

behavioral_health_assessment._comment: G3: How behavioral health needs were assessed
behavioral_health_assessment.other_methods: We Locally assessed the needs of the community by engaging with our partners in the Police and Fire Department, along with the Reginal Recovery and advocate Center.
behavioral_health_assessment.barriers: We have made contributions to the local recovery center form them to be able to assist more citizens. We will assess the need annually and continue to contribute to affected areas.

planning.process: Our municipality conducted its own planning process.

how_spent: Support evidence-based withdrawal management services for people with OUD and co-occurring mental health conditions
Make capital expenditures to rehabilitate and expand facilities that offer treatment for OUD, in partnership with treatment providers

Provide peer support specialists that support people in accessing OUD treatment, trauma-informed counseling and recovery support, harm reduction services, primary healthcare, or other services support for recovery across the continuum
Support or expand peer-recovery centers, which may include support groups, social events, computer access, or other services for persons with OUD
Provide transportation to treatment or recovery services for persons with OUD
Increase the number and capacity of high-quality recovery programs to help people in recovery

Engage non-profits, faith-based communities, and community coalitions to support people in treatment and recovery and to support family members in their efforts to support the person with OUD in the family

connections_to_care.barriers: will look into in the future

how_spent: Provide training and education regarding naloxone and other drugs that treat overdoses
Active outreach strategies such as the Drug Abuse Response Team model or the Post Overdose Support Team model
Other (please specify):: pick up to assist individuals who need recovery services, narcan, education on opioids and training
Supported programs, policies, and practices that have demonstrated effectiveness in preventing drug misuse among youth
Supported community-based education or intervention services for families, youth, and adolescents at risk for OUD
Compensating people with lived and living experience for their time and expertise that they contribute
Other (please describe): regional center to help over 2,800 individuals
